page.title: 16Berwick railway station
page.content: Berwick station on British Rail's Southern Region south coast route between Eastbourne and Lewes and thence to Brighton or London, serves twelve to fifteen surrounding villages. It is manned part time but is well kept with pretty hanging flower baskets, part of the Beautiful Britain scheme. Car parking is on both sides of the station and the Cuckmere Community Buses park here. Apart from one National Bus service these are the only means of public transport in the area. Trains run hourly between 10am and 4pm with two or three per hour at peak periods. Commuters, students and shoppers are the main users. There is no newsagent in the village but papers are sold at the station by the staff. The signal box and level crossing over the B2l08 are immediately adjacent. A taxi service is available opposite.
